name: Grave Robbin' Graduates
description:
You and your humble lab partner are competing in the 197th Creature Faire. To win this competition, you must rob graves and hospitals for body parts and organs to make your creation. But, don’t get to greedy - collecting extra body parts and organs will make the townsfolk angrier. If they get too angry they will storm the castle. Be the first to complete your creature and bring it to life with electricity, proclaiming… It’s Alive!

name: Stiga Bowling
description: A bowling game where you spin a gyro on a sloping field against the pins

name: WyrmRider
description:
WyrmRider is a 2 player microgame in the one page "postcard" style

Setup: One player places the 3 wyrms anywhere on the 6 spaces on their side of the board. The other player places the 4 riders anywhere on the six spaces on their side. Players may orient the counters in any direction.

Play: Beginning with the wyrm player, each player takes a turn by rotating, moving and combatting.

Rotating - A player may rotate their counter 60° clockwise or counterclockwise.

Moving - The player may then move any counter 1 hex in distance in any direction, maintaining the counter’s current orientation. If the player chose not to rotate a counter they may instead move a counter 2 hexes in distance.

Combatting - After rotating, and/or moving, a player may attack one adjacent piece of the opposing player with any of their counters. A player may only attack in the directions indicated by the red arrows (arrows must point perpendicular to an adjacent hex side). Players each roll one six-sided die, the attacking player gains a +1 to their roll.

If the attacker’s roll is greater than the defender, the defending piece is removed.

If the defender has more than one counter adjacent to the attacking counter and they have lost combat, they may immediately combat once as a new attacker, before the start of their normal turn. The +1 rule applies.

Win: A player wins by moving one of their counters on to the 
opposing player’s home space.

name: Star Trek: The Next Generation – The Final Frontier
description:
Star Trek The Next Generation The Final Frontier Action Game.

The Ferengi are up to their capitalist ways again. They have overrun the engineering room and are going after the energy matter/anti-matter reaction chamber. They are trying to steal the dilithium crystals to sell on the open market. These crystals are the energy system on the U.S.S. Enterprise. They would secure at least 5000 bars of gold pressed latinum for the Ferengi, and would turn the Starship Enterprise incapable of warp travel. Your mission is to defend the engineering room against the Ferengi and not let them get away with any of the crystals. Your mission is clear...Engage!

PLAY SUMMARY:

Get your scoops ready to catch the Ferengi as they leave the five Jefferies tube openings, as the phasers are pulled from the matter/anti-matter reaction chamber. Catch a Ferengi and get a piece of your Starship Enterprise. Catch the dilithium crystal by mistake and you loos a piece of your U.S.S. Enterprise. Be first to complete your scoring disk and you win.

name: Smack it!
description: A combination of War and Slapjack. Players place cards on the table, then duke it our War-style when a challenge card comes up, or try to slap the pile when a Smack It card comes up. Whoever has the highest card for a challenge, or is the first to slap the pile on a Smack It, gets the pile. Players who run out of cards are out of the game. As a twist, eliminated players may slap card piles to remove cards from play completely.

name: Booty
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Treasures of all types — yet the hard part is not capturing the ship's bounty, but dividing it fairly among the pirates! Players take turns splitting each round's booty into shares for the other players. Different types of treasures have different values, and of course there's the hidden items to keep people guessing. Will you be the quartermaster to give everyone their fair share – but giving yourself the best share?

Each round in Booty, cards representing treasures are revealed. Some are worth points immediately, some items cancel others, some give you a chance (but not a guarantee) for a big payday. The quartermaster, a job that travels from player to player, divides the treasures into shares and also includes the order of picking treasures in the next round. Balancing what you need, what others might want, and trying to get a little extra into your treasure pile is the key to success!

The building cards provide many special benefits that allow for a broad range of strategies every time you play.

name: King Chocolate
description:
Game description from the publisher:

You know there is money in chocolate, but it doesn't just grow on trees. You need to control the links in the production chain to get your cut of the cash, to make sure the cocao flows through your businesses instead of your competitors'.

Sometimes you need to help your customers and suppliers to help yourself. If you are wily, you can figure out a way for your competitors to do the work for you. Create monopolies, cut off the supply chain, disrupt other players' finely honed plans — do whatever it takes to become King Chocolate.

The fruit of the cacao tree goes through six steps to become chocolate. You can control only a few of these steps, so you  must work with your fellow chocolate makers to keep the chocolate flowing through the production chain. It sounds cooperative and friendly — but did we mention that the chocolate maker with the most money wins? Things always get complicated when money is involved.

To ensure your portion of the production process is used the most so that it earns you cash, occasionally you'll help your customers and suppliers. At the same time, you will attempt to crush your competitors, force others to help you, and manipulate the supply chain.

You'll do whatever it takes to become the king of chocolate.

name: Gomora: Down Town
description:
COMPONENTS
Base set contains 54 unique Cards, Token Punchboard, the game's Board and Rulebook. The Extended version contains 84 unique cards, as opposed to 54 cards in the regular set.

OVERVIEW
Gomora : Downtown is a Neo-noir card game for 2-4 players. It can be played 1vs1, 2vs2 (co-op mode) or Free for all. The game is for ages 15+ and it lasts 15-45 minutes.

You are a detective in the city of Gomora. You will take a path between good and evil in a corrupt city full of eccentric and controversial characters. Nothing can be taken for granted. Your goal is to try and solve perplexing crimes that implicate multiple powerful interests. Gomora's criminal underbelly is after you....so hurry up detective.

This game consists of 84 cards each with a unique photo-realistic artwork. There are 4 tokens representing the 8 Detectives and a game board with 4 locations to move around in order to find clues and complete your case.

HOW TO PLAY
When your turn starts you draw a card or you store cards under your case. Then you have to move to a different location and play it's ability if you wish to. The third step allows you to play your cards. Alternatively you can rest during the third step so that you recover one life point. After you are done playing cards, make sure to keep only 4 cards in your hand and you turn is over.

PROLOGUE
How did you get here? What did you do? Why are they after you? In the city of Gomora the rules are made by those who rule the streets, and those who govern the masses are in their back pocket. The city is corrupt to the bone. Nothing is clear and no man knows what is true and what is fiction, which is convenient for some. Pacifism is not an option. If you pretend to be “good”, you‘ll probably end up in a ditch, or worse. If you pretend to be “bad”, vengeance will be upon you sooner or later. The only way forward is to lurk in the shadows, stay unseen until the day you’ll do what needs to be done. Believe in what you feel rather than what you see, because in this town nothing is what it seems.
Every day in Gomora is a struggle for survival and as far as I know… today is not a good day for you to die.

Show them what you 've got detective..

STORY
Bloody Sunday 6am.... Agent's Kiran and Mark have just arrived in the crime scene three miles away from Casino Montenegro.
Mark:- Morning Mike...so what’s the story?
Officer Mike:- Good day to you Sir...
Mark:- It doesn't seem like one...but please continue.
Officer Mike:- It looks like this poor guy has been shot several times by a Niner last night. The doc said the hit was around midnight.
Mark:- Any evidence gathered?
Officer Mike:- Not yet Sir. We are still examining the surroundings. Just got here half an hour ago.
Kiran:- Ok then we will be down town taking our breakfast so if you have any news from the morgue or the crime scene contact Gloria in 4237. We will take it from there (Agents walking away).
Deputy Jones: (shouting)- Agent Kiran...!!
Kiran:- Yes how can I help you Deputy Jones (walks towards him).
Deputy Jones:- May I have a word with you in private?
Kiran:- Sure...lets walk.
Deputy Jones:- I have found this note. The guy was holding it but in a way that if somebody placed it there...in his grip.
Kiran:- And why are you giving that to me old friend (smiles)?
Deputy Jones:- Just take a look and you'll understand why (Deputy Jones grasps Kiran’s shoulder).
After a while in the car
Mark:- (after a few minutes of silence) What's wrong man? Come on spit it out... 
Kiran:- It's nothing... Old Jones just wanted to give me some guidelines... Not a big deal.
Mark:- Sure thing...now pass me over that note he gave you.
Kiran:-(surprised) Ok Mark you win....the note was from Fox. I guess we will have to cover that up again....any ideas?
Mark:- (speaks with emphasis) And again she strikes without warning....that crazy b#*@$. 
Kiran:- You know that this will start a war right?
Mark:- This was Viny's little brother there… I am prepared for everything....

name: Deckarspelet
description:
480 questions about prominent whodunit books, TV series, movies and real events.

Categories are chosen by a toss of the dice and the first player to 15 points wins the game.

name: Blue Water Fleet
description:
Two fleets clash in a fast paced and exciting game of naval and air combat for two players - or up to four players if two sets of the game are used, Each player tries to find his opponent's ships, hidden within sea cards - and sink them before his opponent do the same.

The game is played with two sets of 'sea' cards arrayed in 5 stacks of 7 cards each - a total of 35 sea cards for each player/fleet, in those cards the players must hide 6 ships: Battleship, Cruiser, Aircraft carrier, two destroyers, submarine and two Mines cards, the ships and mines can be placed in any order and possition within those 5 stacks.

During the game the players use a selection of three types of action cards, attack cards (red) Recon cards (blue) and Fleet cards (green), at each round players start with six cards on their hand, their composition (how many cards from each type they will have) is given by the 'formation' their fleet is following, for example: the recon formation will give more recon cards to a player than attack and fleet cards while a more aggresive formation (Full attack) will give to the player more attack cards than recon and fleet.

While the players only have six action cards on their hands at the start of each round discarding any that they use during the round and drawing new ones to replenish their hand (according to the formation they are in) they also have the 'Hangar deck' space, where they may land aircraft cards (some cards within the action decks are 'Aircraft cards') the hangar deck can have up to 6 aircraft cards and those cards can be used to attack and or to defend the fleet from attacking aircraft, a land/resupply system of not-ready / ready aircraft in the game simulates the whole process of landing aircraft supplying them and taking them off to accomplish missions.
   
Game Contents:
70 sea cards.
63 attack cards.
63 recon cards.
63 fleet cards.
lots of damage counters.
2 formation dials
2 formation pointers
2 hangar space decks.
Rulebook
 game was ranked 6th in the Epitrapezio contest (Greece 2015)

name: Renaissance Wars
description:
It was a time of wealth and intrigue. A turbulent time, when wars were fought over religion and territory. A time when artists, architects and writers explored the nature and potential of man and a time when horizons were broadened so far, that a whole new world was discovered!

In Renaissance Wars you play the game as a Renaissance Luminary... someone whose influence and fame has transcended his own time! Using only your unique Luminary powers, the cards in your hand and cunning strategy, you will battle up to 3 opponents to accumulate the wealth and power necessary to dominate each era of the game.

But be careful... because when you least expect it, something may occur that completely upsets the balance of power and may destroy even the most carefully laid plans!

The base game contains 6 playable Luminaries - William Shakespeare, Martin Luther, Fillipo Brunelleschi, St. Ignatius of Loyola, Christopher Columbus and Francis Bacon - all of which come with their own unique Luminary Mats, cards and portaits. Up to 6 more Luminaries will be available in Special Editions.

Unique Event and Intrusion cards are randomly seeded into the game during set-up, so you never know exactly what you may encounter!

Featuring beautiful art and history, Renaissance Wars explores the people and events that made the Renaissance one of most interesting, creative and important historical eras.

name: Sub Runners
description:
Sub Runners is a historical-fiction Pacific submarine adventure.

STORY

In 1942, As VJ day looms near, Maximillion Erhardt directs a secret submarine full of Chinese gold to secret locations to secure retirement gold for Nazi SS. Gary Shaft, a captain in the American Navy, is on the hunt for the submarine and, most importantly, the gold. Meanwhile, Hajime Yamamoto stockpiles ammunitions and weapons to mine the incoming American Fleet.

A generation later...

America Shaft looks on as her son Kirk dives deeper than he has ever swam before checking on a local tip about the Nazi Gold. The modern spy and government infiltrator, Olli Valentiner, manipulates the local governments, listing the Shafts as enemies of state. In other news, a string of murders has occurred across Asia as the twins, Hero and Kira Yamamoto leave their mark on the traitors who lost their family’s wealth.
 GOALS

Sub Runners is a card-driven deduction game for three players. Players take on the roles of three families: The Erdharts, The Shafts, or The Yamamotos. Players gather resources across the world trying to complete their initial goals. The Erhardts: to make three gold deposits, The Yamamotos: to sink the search Corvette, and The Shafts: to sink the submarine. Once the submarine has been mined, Heinrich dies, or the submarine completes three drops, it crashes somewhere in the vast ocean.

The final goals now come to bear. The Shafts must find the crash in the ocean and then recover the gold. The Yamamotos may recover the gold or kill all the other players. The Erhardts may kill the other players or defend the crash site until one of the play decks has been exhausted to win.

name: Black Hand
description:
Black Hand is a bluffing and deduction microgame for 3 to 6 players. In it, players take on the role of members of the Black Hand, the secret society responsible for the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand and the beginning of World War I. The  aim  is  to  correctly  guess  the  correct combination of assassination weapons (pistols, knives, bombs, and poison) required to kill the Archduke. There’s a hitch in the plans, however—there are traitors hidden within the Black Hand, who work for the Crown and are looking to uncover the assassination plot! Players are secretly divided into  those  loyal  to  the  cause  and traitors who seek to thwart the plot to assassinate the Archduke. Players have to determine who they can trust and who is hiding an ulterior motive!

This game was designed to be entered into the 2015 BGG & Geekway to the West Microgame Competition. It is played with 46 mini-cards (each mini-card is half the size of a poker-size playing card).

name: Pitch'n Goal
description: Pitch'n Goal is a flicking sports simulation along the lines of Pitch'n Dunk, Pitch Bowl, or Caveman Curling. Just as those games simulate their respective sports, this one simulates soccer (known as football everywhere but the USA). Discs represent the players and the ball. The game sports variants for 3–4 participants and star players with special abilities. The first team to score 2 goals wins the game.

name: Legendary Showdown: Machines & Magic
description:
Legendary Showdown: Machines and Magic combines the worlds of Girl Genius & Gunnerkrigg Court to create comically epic battles!

The worlds of Girl Genius and Gunnerkrigg Court are about to collide in a legendary showdown!  Legendary Showdown: Machines & Magic is a game of comically epic battles where each player uses strategy, sabotage, and one-upmanship to develop a secret battle plan.  This lighthearted and easy-to-learn tabletop game is designed to be enjoyed by experienced gamers and newcomers alike.  Haven’t read the comics before? No problem! No background reading is required to help your characters win battles and be the last one left standing! Let the mass chaos, devious strategies, and humorous battles begin!

Who is this Girl Genius?
Girl Genius is a three-time winner of the highest honor awarded for works of science fiction and fantasy: the prestigious Hugo Award.  The webcomic follows Agatha Clay, a seemingly mild-mannered mechanic who discovers she has inherited the abilities of a spark (a feared mad scientist with the natural ability to understand complex sciences and wield them for their own chaotic purposes). Even more shocking, Agatha discovers that she is the descendent of a long lost line of sparks whose unparalleled skills and insanity made them legends in their own time.  Cleverly written and beautifully illustrated by Kaja and Phil Foglio, Girl Genius is full of adventure, romance, and plenty of MAD SCIENCE!

What is this “Gunnerkrigg Court” of which you speak?
This highly praised comic is the work of the celebrated author and artist, Tom Siddell.  The story follows Antimony Carver as she attends an isolated boarding school called Gunnerkrigg Court.  Antimony soon learns that the Court is no ordinary school - the teachers are hiding ancient conspiracies, it is bordered by a forest full of dangerous monsters, and the school is inhabited by strange creatures and students with special abilities.  In the course of her adventures, Antimony befriends an ancient trickster god, discovers her own supernatural powers, and begins investigating the dark secrets of the court.

Why do we love these comics so darn much?
If you aren’t already faithful readers, allow me to let you in on a little secret: these comics rock.  The stories are masterfully crafted, the art is top notch, and the characters are instantly endearing.  It's no wonder that these comics have won so many rewards and attracted such loyal fans.  We also appreciate that both comics feature characters who make great role models.  For example, Antimony Carver and Agatha Clay are some of the strongest and most intelligent women you could hope to meet and their friends will stop at nothing to stand by their sides.

How to play the game that will... change your life:
Each player is dealt a total of five characters from the worlds of Girl Genius and Gunnerkrigg Court.  These characters line up in anticipation for their chance to battle.  During the round, you try to equip characters in your line with powerful weapons and bonuses while equipping characters in other players’ lines with faulty or otherwise terrible equipment.  You can also give yourself secret advantages or sabotage your opponents.  When the round ends, the characters at the front of each line will engage in a (legendary) showdown.  But the madness doesn’t stop there!  You can rearrange your line and the lines of your opponents to change who will be competing in the final battle.  The round suddenly ends when all players but one (the poor chap) are ready to fight.  At that point, each player reveals his or her battle strategy and the winner is decided.

name: Beardos
description: Are you a facial hair aficionado? Do you think you know famous beards? Well then, this is your chance to impress!  Players are given clues, one at a time, from the player wearing the beard card. The quicker you guess the famous beard, the more points you'll score. Can you Name That Beard?

name: The Siege
description: The board for The Siege  features a 3D castle. The castle is easy to assemble and fits snugly back into the box without the need to dismantle it. The game is asymmetric – one player (or a team of up to three) attacks the castle, and the other player (or team) is defending it. Knight models come in six colours. All knights are armed with either swords or maces. The blue ones always attack the castle, and are the only team to have two catapults. The red ones always defend. Four of the red knights have bows and arrows instead of melee weapons. The remaining four teams are black, orange, yellow and green. The number of knights in different teams is not always the same. There are always more defenders than attackers. Combat is conducted in duels. Mace wielding combatants have the upper hand, but the outcome is decided by rolling the dice. Each player is trying to overpower their opponents by outnumbering them in isolated combats. Apart from the knights, the box also includes a king, a queen, a princess, a wizard, a dragon and a squire. These models are used in special scenarios.

name: Anything To Declare?: The International Game of Smuggling and Detection
description:
You are the owner of a shipping line required to unload containers in a port, and move around the board collecting cargoes for delivery to a warehouse.  As well as this, you must control movements of your lorry and also use your own customs security piece to follow and challenge containers carried by other players.

The bluff element in the game centres around decisions on whether to pay premiums to insure cargoes moving through the docks, and once at the lorry park you must decide whether to declare goods for payment or not.

Strategy elements include decisions on which piece you will move on each turn, or whether you use you throw to hire a forklift or crane.  The detection element involves guessing whether all your opponents are as innocent as they pretend or if they are not declaring their full cargo.

name: Countdown to Disaster
description:
You’re a military demolitions expert working in hostile territory that’s been called in to defuse a massive car bomb found outside a luxury resort hotel.  You’ve evacuated the parking lot and setup your equipment; you begin to examine the bomb when suddenly the bomb timer starts to countdown from 16 minutes and your heart rate just went into overdrive.  Upon further inspection you notice the bomb is controlled by an encrypted code sequencer and you need to figure out how to connect your Code Analyzer to the bomb’s timer.  Your new high-tech Code Analyzer is used to bypass the bomb’s timer and prevent the bomb from exploding. To do this you must figure out the wiring sequence from the mass of wires in front of you and rewiring the device to include your code analyzer, which will override the timer and allow you to defuse the bomb safely!  You have less than 16 minutes to figure out the wiring sequence and connect your Code Analyzer.  If you can figure out this circuit and connect each of the four individual wires from the bomb timer to your code analyzer, you will safely stop the timer and eventually defuse the bomb; saving the resort from certain disaster!  Countdown to disaster begins…

Countdown to Disaster is a combination tile placement, card management game and race against the clock style game. Your Code Analyzer has [4] color coded wires “Red, Green, Blue and Yellow” which must be connected to the timer of the bomb so as to be able to bypass the timer and prevent the bomb from exploding! These connections will be made through the [16] wire routing tiles on the game board. The bomb itself is amass of wires, which is represented by the 4x4 grid of wire tiles on the game board that are routed in different directions to try and prevent you from defusing the robot. Your goal is to figure out the four individual wire routes to connect your code analyzer to the robot's timer. You must figure out a complete connection route for each wire from the code analyzer to the bomb's timer before the timer runs out and the bomb explodes!
You have special wiring tools that allow you to manipulate the wires and create or change the route of each existing wire or wires. With your tools in hand you can swap wires vertically and horizontally 1, 2, or 3 spaces. You can also rotate the direction of a specific wire or wire group up to 360 degrees. The last tool allows you to actually cut out “replace” a wire or wire group with a new wire or wire group from the bottom four tiles! When you replace a wire or wire group you can rotate the tile to the position of your choice.

name: Viking Conquerors: An Epic Game of Viking Adventure.
description:
BACKGROUND: Viking Conquerors is an adventure game for 1-4 Players, where players assume the roles of young Viking Huskarls (minor Chieftains) during in the Middle Ages. Each Player creates a Viking Character in search of Wealth, Adventure and Renown. To survive and thrive in the harsh and unforgiving world of Medieval Europe, the Player Vikings must take part in Raids, Blood-Feuds, Exploration, and Conquest. As your Viking gains experience and renown they can improve their attributes and Social and Military Status to eventually become Jarls (Earls) or even a King!

GAME OBJECTIVE: The Objective of each Player Viking is to Gain the most Territories and Renown Points in order to increase your Social and Military Standing. Player Vikings start out as Huskarls, a minor Chieftain with right to own a Ship and in control of one Territory.

GAME FEATURES: Viking Conquerors features many, many colorful game counters, rules for brutal man-to-man combat resolved in a fast and fun manner, and loads of Viking lore.

name: Smoking Gun
description:
Smoking Gun is the winner of the 2015 BGG Microgame Design Contest!

Smoking Gun, a noir tale of crimes, secrets, and investigations. Players take on the role of detectives, piecing together a central case in which their reputations (and even their lives) are at stake. In the end, only one detective will crack the case and become the hero... but at what cost?

This microgame consists of only 18 cards (plus player references), 12 of which are used in a given game. Players can enjoy one game, lasting 5-10 minutes, or a series of games, using the included "The Long Night" mode.

A complete Print & Play file (3 pages of cards, black and white, double-sided), including rules, is available.

name: Aquaducts
description:
Download link: http://bit.ly/1ECXIZk

A complete Print & Play file (3 pages of cards, color, single-sided), including rules, is available at the link above. Players will also need a standard 6-sided die of any size or color.

In ancient times, the aquaduct was an engineering marvel, bringing fresh water into cities choked with pollution and waste. You are a fledgling engineer with big plans for the future. If you can build aquaducts to every part of your city, provide much-needed amenities, and gain the people's favor, you will go down in history!

This microgame consists of 24 cards, played as tiles in a city layout. Players get only one run through the deck, and must use their limited resources to expand, navigate, and build their city. The game features 4 difficulty levels (based on the size of the city), and offers great strategic gameplay with very few components.

name: Cauldron
description:
Cauldron is a competitive board game set in a fantasy world. Taking on roles of powerful mystical characters like the Druid, the Shaman or the Wizard, players will brew potions to grow their magical power, while casting spells to stop others from getting ahead. Cauldron is a resource management game that plays with 2-5 players aged 10+ in 1 hour.

Play revolves around a central set of fields, producing potion ingredients each season (frog legs, spider webs, dragon eggs etc). Each player has potions - way to combine ingredients to score Magik (game's victory points and currency). Players take turns harvesting ingredients, brewing potions and attempting to steal ingredients from competitors. Each player also has a hand of spells - one-time effects that help the player or hinder opponents. Each character has variable powers that modifies the way basic actions are resolved.

After all ingredients have been harvested, players have a chance to invest some of their Magik to buy additional potions, spells or add fields to the game board. Balancing investment with advancement is a crucial part of the game.

The game proceeds until one of the player reaches 35 Magik - that player is the winner. The game has an element of luck and conflict present but the majority of it revolves around resource management, planning and balancing short and long term investment.

name: Pass the Blame: The Party Game For Irresponsible Adults
description:
This is a game of concocting the best excuse to get out of unfortunate situations.  Players are presented with a Situation card, for example:

    There’s a giant slice missing from the birthday cake, and the party hasn’t even started.
    There are muddy footprints all over the new white carpet.
    Your friend’s collection of vintage action figures was mistakenly donated to the holiday toy drive.


The player must then write down who is to blame and why.  Then the answers are scored based on best and worst excuse.

name: Chaos Tactics
description:
Chaos Tactics is a dexterity game where skill and strategy are needed to defeat your opponent by using your army of eight units. Players battle over a series of rounds by flicking their units until one player claims the entire board. Each army contains seven different unit types with one type, the soldier, having two units per side. The six non soldier units have special abilities that can be used throughout the game. The constant action will create chaotic battles making each round feel like an entirely new game.
 The player using the blue pieces starts the game by choosing one of their pieces and flicking it. Once the piece is flicked, resolve any special abilities if applicable. The red player then takes their first turn by doing the same. Play alternates like this until the round is over; with the goal being to knock all of the opponent’s pieces off the game board entirely. If any part of a piece is still on the game board, it is still in play.

A round is won when only one color remains on the board. With each round won, the winner claims a new row allowing them to place a piece or pieces in that row in the next round. For the following rounds, players may place their pieces in any of the spaces of the rows they own, with at least one piece in the row closest to their opponent.

The game is won when one color has claimed all eight rows.

Inspired by Chapayev

name: Swamped
description:
Swamped is a semi-cooperative game of adventure, peril and treasure in which players move through a swamp searching for a rare herb that can cure diseases. Each player takes a turn steering the boat to find the herb. But the swamp has many other treasures as well, so players may try to steer the boat away from its intended goal to increase their own wealth.

Swamped is a game for 2-4 adventurers that plays in about 30 minutes and expands the vibrant world of Antidote. In addition to a one-of-a-kind theme, there are five core elements that make Swamped incredibly fun and a surprisingly unique gaming experience:

1. Player-shared pieces: All players share ownership of the same tiny boat in the swamp, so the actions of any one player impact every other player directly.

2. Secret and shared objectives: Everyone knows the main objective, but each player also has a hidden goal that might lead the whole expedition into deadly peril!

3. Player controlled game-length: Players can speed-up or slow-down the game down depending on their preference. Some will try to get out of the swamp quickly, while others will delay until they've collected precisely the right combination of treasures.

4. Surprise ending: It is unlikely that anyone can know with 100% certainty who has won the game before each player's secret objective is revealed, leading to an exciting reveal at the very end!

5. Efficient use of physical components: Despite its small size (35 cards and two pieces), most cards have multiple uses and orientations leading to a surprisingly deep set of decisions each player can make. Furthermore, as players move deeper into the swamp, the swamp expands from the action card deck, opening up greater adventure, while at the same time triggering a built-in game timer.

name: Battle for Biternia

Battle for Biternia combines the aesthetic of classic role-playing video games with the gameplay of the wildly popular Multiplayer Online Battle Arena (MOBA) genre.

Take control of a team of four heroes and do battle with your opponent.  Take down their defensive towers and destroy their Elemental Crystal to win!  Each of the 19 Heroes is different, with unique powers that they can gain over the course of the game.

name: Round We Go
description:
Round We Go is a strategic family board game.

The goal is to race to the center of the board. First person to get both of their player pieces to the center wins the game.

The trick is that pieces are unable to turn on their own, which can cause you to go round and round on the circular board, unless you plan accordingly.

Players must strategically place arrow pieces on the board to either help them advance or force opponents to backtrack. However, it is important to remember, in a game of circles, sometimes what goes around comes around.

name: Sikarra: Volcano Island
description:
Sikarra, a volcano island rich in a rare resource that could launch your corporation years ahead in their research…or one of the multiple other companies that are racing to find it before you. Extracting the resources from Sikarra will not be an easy job; it is rife with dangers; cannibals, pterodactyls, and the volatile volcano itself. The slopes of the volcano are covered in a dense jungle that is very difficult for modern machinery to penetrate. The only people able to move through this difficult terrain easily are the local tribe…rumor has it they may even be able to travel on the backs of the great winged pterodactyls that circle the volcano. Befriending the tribe may be the only way for your corporation to be the first to reach the rare resources and come out on top.

“Jungle power rules Sikarra. In the jungle the tribe is king…”

The game is playable by 2-4 players.

Players vie against one another for control of the 6 territories of Sikarra attempting to harvest its rare resources while making use of favors traded by other players for much needed equipment. Players will need to stay a step ahead of the deadly volcano, cannibals and circling pterodactyls all the while trying to befriend the ruling tribe through completion of tasks in the tribes name if they want to succeed let alone stay alive.

Winning Conditions: Players must gain support of the tribe (10 support) or have enough forces to overpower the tribe (10 pieces of equipment). The way players gain the support of the tribe is by completing tasks that support the tribe from the tasks list.

Task List:


     Build a tribute to the tribe on a territory you control. Cost: 2 Resources & 1 Equipment
     Give back to nature. Select one free area and keep it clear of harvesting for one round.
     Slash and Burn. Destroy a section of jungle in a territory you control. Gain 3 Resources. Move down one spot on tribe support track.
     Bribe local officials. Move once for free at any time this round. Cost: 2 Resources. Move down one spot on tribe support track.


Players move through the following phases each round while trying to show the tribe they are most worthy of their support to control each resource rich territory:

1. Purchase/Place Equipment
2. Cannibals Attack.
3. Politics/Tasks.
4. Lava/Ash Track.
5. Harvest.
6. Intrigue.
7. Move.

Can you lead your corporation to success? Can you harvest the power of the jungle and rule Sikarra: Volcano Island?

name: Mishpuchah & Mishegoss
description:
Microgame submission for 2015 Geekway to the West Design Competition. The game is a two player card game that takes about 30 minutes to play. It utilizes a deck of 18 cards.

When the mishpuchah get together, it should be a time of nachas, but there are always some tsouris.  Such mishegoss!  (Translation for the Yiddush impaired:  When the relatives get together, it should be a time of joy, but there are always woes.  Such craziness!)

Deal out the guests for the family get-together, then seat them one at a time.  Gain points by making your guests happy.  Some members are particular about whom they sit with, while others have family members whom they wouldn't be caught dead next to.  For most rounds, there will be one branch of the family who is offended and won't score any points at all.  The game is over when everyone has been offended at least once.

name: Linkeballen
description:
A strategic cycling parlor game for 2-4 players, 8 years and above

Will your team win the tour?
Going for the yellow or do you choose for the team? Climbing the hills or pushing it on a flat stage?
Keep in mind you’re not the only one cycling the road… A small steering error, misjudgment or a ‘cycling strategy’ can cause a sensational collision.
Let your cycling team ride as fast as possible and win the bike race!

Introduction
In this parlor game you play within the stages as a cycling team. A team consists of three riders. The basic game can be played with 2 to 4 players. The duration of a one stage game with 4 players is 1 to 1.5 hours.
. The results of your team and players standings are recorded. A Tour consists of several stages, with the fastest rider over several stages wearing the yellow jersey. You decide for how long and which stages you want to play.
The game is played with cards. By placing a card on the table you decide how fast you are moving your riders on the trail. You try taking tactical moves and benefit from wind advantage by letting your opponent do the hard work. Cast or save your good cards to démarrage when you feel that your opponent cannot. In short: “Linkeballen”.

Note:
If you have the additions as well, you can play up to 24 players.

name: Galloway
description:
This is a card deck & game system with multiple suits, inspired by little ponies, and designed with young players in mind.

Unlike a standard deck of cards, this deck features six "mane" suits: Generosity, Honesty, Kindness, Laughter, Loyalty, and Magic.

The deck also features three other suits: Earth Pony, Pegasus, and Unicorn. The mane suits of Honesty and Laughter are adorned with the Earth Pony suit. Kindness and Loyalty are adorned with the Pegasus suit. Generosity and Magic feature the Unicorn suit.

Furthermore, another pair of suits split the deck in half: the Moon and Sun. Honesty, Laughter, and Loyalty lie under the Moon. Generosity, Kindness, and Magic under the Sun.

The deck is available as a print-and-play game.

name: Crack the Code
description:
Crack the Code with three levels of challenge is a brain testing game of logic and mental concentration. The object of the game is to crack the secret code of your opponent by means of simple logic and deduction. Players challenge each other in turn by setting out a row of three, four or five coloured code counters according to the level of skill and difficulty to be played. The game can be made even tougher by allowing the code maker to use any number of the same coloured counters, and or leave spaces, to make up the code.

The code maker sets up the sliding screen so that it is placed directly in front of them just allowing space to place and hide their secret code in the spaces provided. The code breaker must try to duplicate the exact colours and positions of the secret code. Each attempt is marked with a tick for an exact colour and position match or a cross for the correct colour but incorrect position.

Players swap roles and the winner is the one who breaks the code in the least number of attempts.

name: Adorable Pandaring
description:
Your goal (both in life and in this game) is to have the most adorable pandas. However, the fickle Panda Laws of Adorableness change often, and with them which pandas are adorable. Playing your pandas cleverly and navigating the Laws well will reward you in bamboo! You want that.

The gameplay of Adorable Pandaring is easy to learn. The deck consists of four copies each of ten pandas, numbered 1-10, and four Panda Law cards [High(6-10), Low(1-5), Even, Odd]. On your turn you will play one hidden panda face down, and one panda face up.  Your face up panda uses a special ability to do something -- steal a panda, change the Panda Law, or even gain bamboo!

The Red Panda sits in the middle of the table, ready to award bamboo. If your turn starts and you can see four currently adorable pandas (by the Panda Law), scoring happens. You take the Red Panda card, and follow the instructions on the back. All hidden pandas are revealed, and everyone with at least two adorable pandas in play gets a bamboo. The player(s) with the most adorable pandas get a second bonus bamboo. Then, all adorable pandas are shuffled back into the deck (Other pandas remain). You choose a new Panda Law, and play continues. When someone gets to five bamboo, they win!

Games last 5-15 minutes, and Adorable Pandaring can be played with 3-5 players.

name: Lobotomy
description:
Take the role of escaped mental patients in this fully cooperative board game for 1 to 5 players. Enter the abandoned mental hospital from your worst nightmares. Each player controls a different crazy character with their own story and phobias which can become reality in any moment. There is one goal: to escape. But it is not easy when you think that all the staff are the evil monsters and the warden is the worst of them.

Lobotomy is a scenario based adventure/dungeon crawler game. Lobotomy introduces such features as:


    big (yes very big) modular board where each module is a different part of the hospital (including outside areas like garden or chapel)
    completely different characters, with their own stories and mental illness which define their skills and powers
    different monsters, mostly based upon the old pulp horror movies
    fight, explore, or learn about your past, but you don't have much time until the warden finds you, and you must be prepared to face him


All characters and monsters have their own awesome miniatures (with over fifty in the base set).

Each round, players race to make words using cards that have a single letter and a two-letter pair on them, and dice that have vowels and wilds. Each card can be used as either its single letter or pair of letters. Each player has two cards in hand to use, as well as three community cards in the middle of the table.

The first to find a five-letter word wins the round, and the first to win five rounds wins the game!

name: Dhex
description:
Dhex (from Dual-Hex) is a Hex derivative that is played with the same components.

Players in turn place 2 adjacent discs on the board, one of each colour.

Whenever a 1-cell hole is created, the player that created it places a disc of her colour on it. Notice that several holes can be created at once, but none as a result of filling.

First to connect his sides wins.

The games are shorter than in Hex, so large boards are recommended (14x14).

name: Patron's Protege
description:
In Patron’s Protégé, you are a lord or lady in the Middle Ages and the time has come for your wards to receive higher education.  You will attempt to give them the best education possible by sending them to classes where they will eventually gain proficiency and use their knowledge to teach their own classes.

Patron's Protégé is a two to four player worker placement micro-game.  The game consists of 12 cards, which are: 7 class cards, 4 player credentials cards, and one Core classes card.  Additionally, there are three punch cards that contain various markers for tracking resources and player pieces.

name: Ayoayo
description:
Ayoayo is a Nigerian mancala game, which is played by the Yoruba. It should not be confused with Oware, which is also sometimes called "Ayoayo" when played in Nigeria. Related games are Andada in Eritrea and Endodoi in Tanzania.

Ayoayo is played on a board of two rows, each consisting of six round pits that have a large store at either end. Each pit contains four seeds at the start.

At his turn a player takes the contents of one of his smaller holes and distributes it, one by one, counterclockwise into the following holes, but not in the stores. If the last seed falls into a non-empty hole, its contents including the last distributed seed is continued to be distributed.

The move ends when the last seed falls in an empty hole.

If the last seed falls in an empty hole on the player's own side, the seeds in the opponent's hole directly across and the seed effecting the capture are captured and placed into the store. If the emptied hole contains twelve or more seeds, it is skipped.

When the opponent has no seeds in his holes, he must get some seeds in the next move, if possible. Otherwise the game is over and the remaining seeds are captured by the player who moved last.

The player who captured most counters wins the game.

Description taken from Mancala World.

name: Bird's Eye View
description:
Rather clever party game.

The box contains 18 pictures and 12 answer cards.

Pablo, always wearing his sombrero, (represented by thick black rings) is a man of many parts. Our artist has drawn his impressions of some of Pablo's activities as seen through a bird's eye from above.

Distribute the pictures about the room and give each player an answer card. They should then be allowed abouf 20 minutes in which to write down their guesses as to what Pablo is supposed to be doing in each picture. The most correct answers, wins.

name: Das bunte Alphabet
description:
A word game for children.

In his turn, a player draws a card which will have a letter on it. He can now move one of his pawns on to a coloured space if he can think of a word that begins with the letter on his card.
On a purple space he must name an object.
On a red space he must name an animal.
On a blue space he must name a fruit or plant.
On a white space he must name a boy or girl's name.
If a correct answer is said, the player keeps the card.
Eventually, both of a players' pawns will reach the middle of the board. Everybody now tries to make the longest word they can, using the letter cards they have collected during the game. The player with the longest word, wins.

name: Picture Puzzles: Familiar Phrases
description:
Party game. The box contains 18 Picture Cards and 12 Answer Cards.
Each picture has some noticeabie feature and the words expressing it generally convey, in everyday usage, quite a different or wider meaning.
Example — 'TO SIT ON THE FENCE'
The usual Interpretation of this phrase is ' to be neutral' or ' not to take sides.' In the picture the expression is conveyed by showing hens (and boy) sitting on a fence.
Distribute the pictures about the area of play and give each player an answer card. A time limit should be fixed and the player who writes down most correct expressions is the winner.
Answer cards should be interchanged for checking.

name: Towns and Cities
description:
Party game with delightful cards.

The illustrated cards are placed around the room where they can easily be seen. Give each player an answer card. Set a time limit. The player who has the most correct answers when 'Time' is called, wins.

The cards feature a number of different illustrations and they are numbered. Players have to look at these images in number order and extract a number of letters from each answer to form the name of an English town or city. They give an example card. There are 5 pictures on that card.
The 1st is a Seal - use the ES
The 2nd is a Step - use the ST
The 3rd is a Bottle - use the BO
The 4th is a Nurse - use the UR
the 5th is a Net - use the NE
Thus, the answer is EA-ST-BO-UR-NE, which is a town on the southern coast of England.

name: Guess My Story
description:
An English party game, loosely based on a long forgotten television show.

12 cards are provided, each of which contains a different personal “ story,” all of them famous in the sense that the Daily Press has, or would have, given them headline publicity. They are modern, historical, legendary, or fiction.

One player to be Chairman. He takes all the cards; no one eise must see them yet. He selects one card and chooses a player (the Challenger) who will answer questions as though he were the person about whom that story was made. The Challenger and the Chairman sit together facing the other players, who become the “ panel.” The Chairman announces to the panel the free information, as printed at the top of the card. This is the only “ free ” information given. The panel have to discover what the Challenger’s story is by questioning him (or her), and they ask any questions they wish, one at a time and in turn. The Challenger gives the answers, Consulting the information provided on the card about “ his own ” story. The Chairman may help and advise the Challenger in his answers. In answering questions, the Challenger should use the first person “ I.”

It is the story which has to be discovered, not necessarily the name of the person concerned, though it is usually simpler for the panel to find the name first, which will lead them to the story quickly.

The Chairman may announce a time limit, say 5 minutes, after which the panel if still unsuccessful have been defeated, and the Challenger announces his story. A new Challenger is selected for each story.

name: Variety Quiz
description:
English party game.

A quiz for your party guests. Up to 12 may play. The host or hostess will read out the questions and the players write down their answers on their answer card.

As the title suggests, the questions will fall into 5 different categories;
Proverbial Last Words: Players must name the proverb just by being told only the last word.
Car Cavalcade: Players must name the manufacturer of the listed car models.
Sur Me: Players are given eight Christian names and eight surnames. Match them correctly to make a list of eight writers.
Triangulation: Players are given a pyramid shape triangle with lines criss-crossing and must write down the correct number of triangles in the image.
Chop and Change: Players are given a statement and the answer must be two words that are anagrams of each other.

The guest with the most correct answers, wins and, hopefully, gets a small gift from the hosts.

name: Melee in the Mines
description:
Melee in the Mines is a print-and-play microgame that pits two players against one another. The dwarves’ silver mine has cut into the tunnels of a monster lair, and now a band of adventurers is fighting for their lives in the narrow confines of the mine against a band of monsters. Each player starts with 7 of 18 characters (18 Monsters or 18 Adventurers). The winner is the party that drives the other from the mine!

Only the first character in each party can use hand-to-hand combat. Other party members can use ranged weapons or special attacks -- provided they have a clear line-of-sight over their companions’ heads. In these tight quarters, jostling for position is important. It’s great to have your troll at the head of your party, given his strength, but then no one behind him can see past him to use a ranged attack. If your halfling is at the front, everyone taller can fire over him, but he himself won’t be doing much damage.

Each turn you can either battle (roll 2 six-sided dice) or take an action (see below) and attack with 1 die. Each die roll is assigned to a character whose abilities match that roll – each card has die faces on it, with corresponding attacks: 1 = Rush, 2 = Strike, 3 = Panic, 4 = Fell, 5 = Do, 6 = Kill.

You can download the 4-page PDF from the Files section. You will need two 6-sided dice.

This game was created for the 2015 BGG Microgame Prototype Design Competition.

name: Dora the Explorer Let's Go! Adventure Game Book
description:
Five basic Dora the Explorer Games, to teach color and number recognition, sequencing, patterning and game play skills.

Included games are "The Race to Abuela's House", "Vines & Logs","Catch the Stars!", "The Nutty Forest Maze" and "Beach day!"

Short description per game:

The Race to Abuela's House: players spin the spinner to race to Abuela's house, but if they land on an obstacle, they need the spinner to land on the corresponding tool before moving on.

Vines & Logs: shortened version of chutes (logs) and ladders (vines).

Catch the Stars!: the game board shows a pattern with six different colours. Players spin the spinner (that shows colours now) to spin the required colours for their next step, in a race to the other side of the board, where te stars await.

The Nutty Forest Maze: players spin the spinner to race to Tico's treehouse. They have to choose the right way through the maxe, and can loose turns (when encountering Swiper the fox) or getting extra moves (when encountering stars).

Beach Day!: players spin the spinner and move to the first next square showing the same picture as the picture shown by the spinner to race to the beach (candy land variation).

name: Skæg med tal-spillet
description:
Det er skægt at tælle med Hr. Skæg. 
I dette spil for førskolebørn lærer de små børn at genkende tallene fra 1 til 10, at tælle fra 1 til 10 og at øve sig på at skrive tallene. 
Drej pilen, flyt brikken på spillepladen og udfør opgaven på kortet. Børnene skal tælle ting, skrive tal, hente ting og pege på ting med forkerte farver. Desuden skal de hoppe forskellige slags hop. For hver opgave barnet klarer vinder det en Skægbrik til sin samleplade.

IN ENGLISH:


It is fun to count with Hr. Skæg.
In this game pre-school children learn to recognize, write and count the numbers from 1 to 10. 
Turn the arrow, move the gamepiece on the board and do the task on the card. The children must count, write numbers, find things og point at objects with wrong colors. And they get to jump different kinds of jumps. For each task the child does, it wins a Skæg-token for the pointboard.

name: Undead States of America: The Zombie War Card Game
description:
You aren't trying to escape a neighborhood filled with walking dead - that was weeks ago.  This isn't about survival any more.

This is war.

The object of Undead States of America is to gather survivors and hold off the undead masses.  It is up to you to rally refugees, build safe zones and lead your rag-tag forces through a psychological nightmare.  In the end, you will find your army of men, women & children surrounded.  Only then will you learn if you've prepared well enough to secure a future for the human race...  (from the back of the box)

Players attempt to build a cadre of fellow survivors, giving them a place to stay and supplies.  There are cards for survivors, supplies, military action (even a nuke!), and even for antagonists (used to fight against you).  The winner is who has scored the best after surviving 4 years.

name: Regata
description:
The game represent race of sailboats. They start from the shore. There are different paths between many islands. Players roll dice and move figurines from field to field in direction of paths.

The first who reach finish gets the most points, but points are also received by collecting counters along the path, by standing on marked field next to counter. The winner is the player who ends up with the most points.

name: Viteška trka
description:
Knight race. The game presents racing of knights. There are different paths. Players roll dice and move figurines in direction of paths.

First who reach finish gets the most points, but points are also received by collecting counters along the path, by standing on marked field next to counter. The winner is the player who ends up with the most points.

name: Šmizling
description:
Šmizling is a game for girls. On the board is presented a shopping center. In stores can be purchased (collected) different clothing items (counters), by standing on marked field next to counter.

The task in not to collect as many counters, but to make certain outfits. The first player who succeed in that is the winner.

name: Tigar u lovu
description:
Tiger in hunt is a simple game for children. Each player has one figurine representing a tiger. On the board are counters where are pictures of various animals that are food for tigers.

Players collect counters by standing on marked field next to counter. Players need to collect as many counters as possbile.

name: Svet tišine
description:
World of Silence is an educational game. Playing the game children learn about animals that live in the sea. Animals are divided by groups: fishes, mammals, reptiles, birds, soft shells, crabs ...

Each player has one figurine, which represents a diver. Divers swim and take photos of a variety of animals, by standing on field with counter. Each photograph (counter) brings one point. It is important to collect as many counter, but it is more important that the counters are in different colors. Each color represents one group of animals.

name: Foto safari
description:
Photo Safari is a simple game for younger players. Each player has one figurine. The figurine represents off road vehicle in which are visitors of safari park. There are different paths.

On the board are counters with pictures of different animals. Players collect counters (photos) by standing on marked filed next to counter. During the game, players need to collect as many counters.

name: Ninja
description:
From back of the box:

Object of the game:
Ninja warriors attack the Fortress. The defenders inside the Fortress walls must prevent them from stealing the treasure.

Ninja is a simple game of movement and dice combat. One player is the attacker while the other player is the defender. Each player's ninja pieces show its movement, range, and attack properties. When two pieces battle, each player adds the attack number of their battling piece to the roll of two dice, with the highest total winning the battle. Eventually, the defender will either have prevented the attacker from stealing the treasure, or the attacker will make off with the treasure, winning the game.  It is suggested that two rounds are played, with players switching roles and comparing the points that they gained when they played the attacker in order to determine a winner.

name: Arrezzo
description:
Arrezzo is played on 8x8 board with a green and a red set of 16 playing pieces with symbols on top. Each set has 2 monks (a cross ), 2 ladies (a circle), 2 lords (a star ), 6 farmers (a square) and 4 knights (a triangle).

These symbols hint on the direction of the slides and jumps every piece is able to make.
Slides are towards a free square in any ortagonal or diagonal direction.
Jumps are combinations ortagonal or diagonal jumps across your own or opponents pieces, depending on the type of piece. Multiple jumps are possible.

Starting from your own two base lines object of the game is to move all your pieces off the board on the opposite side and prevent the opponent from doing so.

name: Sheeplike
description:
Sheeplike is a Theocratic Card Game for family worship based upon going out in the ministry and finding Sheeplike ones and starting bible studies while avoiding Do Not Calls. 2-4 players ages 9+ can play in 30-60 min using tools like the bible, pioneers, Jesus and even Jehovah to win the householders hearts over.  The goal is the first player to 4 bible studies. You gain a bible study by finding the Sheeplike one out in the territory or be the last player still in the round.

Setup:  The territory consists of 9 cards (houses) grouped in 3 piles hiding where the Sheeplike and Do Not Call cards are.   Shuffle the Sheeplike, Do Not Call and 1 Not Interested cards and create 3 piles.  Then deal 2 more territory cards on top of the 3 piles.  Players are each dealt 1 card each from the publisher cards.

The game consists of 2 stages:

Door To Door: Players draw and play cards searching through the territory stacks for the Sheeplike one. There are 17 publisher cards that allow players to flip the cards in the territory and move cards around within the stacks. This allows for players to hide traps and uncover the Sheeplike card. If a Do Not Call is flipped without the protection of the Bible card, that player has to sit out of the current round. If the Sheeplike one is not found by the time that there is no more publisher cards to draw from then the next stage starts.

Return Visit: Once all cards have been drawn from the publisher draw pile. All players turns over their one card in their hand.  Whoever has the highest value card, they get the first pick of where they think the Sheeplike card is at. Remember the players have had a few turns to deduce the most likely location of the Sheeplike one. So when the publisher pile is getting low, it is good to hold onto higher value cards.

name: Superfight: The Loot Crate Deck
description: This is a 100 card version of the viral card game superfight, designed by Skybound for sale on Loot Crate . These cards are only available in this exclusive deck. Create hilarious fighters with these cards, then argue over who would win in a fight between them.

name: We Have Goats!
description:
Coming to Kickstarter May 26, 2015. Innovative tabletop game, with zombie kittens, goat drones, and internet trolls. We Have Goats is a tile-placement racing game that's easy to pick up.  The goal is to get each of your goats to their home pen, while building the board with tile cards and obstacles.  Goat-astrophe cards shift and rearrange the tiles (goat-nadoes, goat-quakes, goat-namis & goat-portals), and the "Goat Lab" cards give your goats special abilities.

Also, there's a chupacabrasaurus.

name: Don't Explode
description:
It is a glorious, shining moment for the National Space Program: launch day is finally here. The crew is suited up and looking dashing, journalists are lined up for miles, and the sky is clear and inviting. There's just one problem: due to a bureaucratic mishap, the rockets aren't scheduled to be assembled until next Tuesday.

You and the other players are high-ranking scientists at the National Space Program, competing to put together the best rocket you possibly can in the final ten minutes before launch. Whoever builds the rocket that gets closest to space, without exploding or suffering a similar fatal catastrophe, wins the game and keeps their job. If every rocket is destroyed, the winner is whoever got the closest.

Don't Explode takes place over two phases, Construction and Launch. During Construction, players will draft cards from the construction deck and add components to their control module, in order to build the best rocket they possibly can in the limited time available. During Launch, players will see how well they did, by using the components which make up their rocket to advance their pawn from the Earth to space (or as close to space as they can get).

name: A Step to Victory
description:
This is a small wargame of the Bougainville campaign, included in "This Sim-Game is Awsome! 2013", an annual zine of wargame review.

This is a 2 pages leaflet game inside the book titled above.

This game covers the Bougainville campaign from American landing on Torokina to the end of war.

The rule is printed in first page with units, and the map is printed in second page. So, you must first make the units.

The game uses very basic land operation sequences, move and combat. This game uses differential CRT instead of usual combat ratio.

The game ends in 10 turns.  And victory is decided by the number of locations the American side has captured.

AVAILABLE FREE NOW.

name: Fotbollsspelet
description:
Fotbollsspelet (“The Soccer Game”) is a two player game where your soccer knowledge decides the outcome. The rulebook also provides rules for playing the game with more players, in teams, making it a cooperative game.

You play as in real soccer, with passes, clinches, shots, penalties, and offside.  Eventually you will discover how important cooperation between the single players are for teamwork. Dice rolling and event cards will bring in randomness, just like in a real game of soccer.

Situation cards with questions about soccer rules are an important part of the game. If you know the rules, it will give you advantages in the game. If you don’t, you will learn the rules playing Fotbollsspelet.

name: Eldorado: La grande corsa all'oro
description: A game set in the Wild West at the time of the gold miners. In the first part of the game players turn to the cities to equip, after facing the journey to the mountain to climb and reach the large deposit of gold. During the journey will find gold and dangers such as Indians and bandits, who can overcome only with equipment cards collected before. Upon reaching the summit of the mountain by a player what he found most gold is the winner.

name: Parasite
description:
Parasites have invaded a zoo in a small town. They are moving from host to host trying to exploit all the different animals. Players will take on the role of parasites and their respective hosts in an attempt to gain or steal the most points by the end of the game.

The game is played with a deck of cards containing a set of colored host cards for each player numbered 2,3,4 and 5. The deck also contains special action cards, one for each player.

Players will also receive four parasite tokens of their selected color valued 1,2,3 and 4. The players colored host cards and parasite tokens represent potential points.

The game starts with one card turned face up next to the draw pile. Drawn cards will be placed next to this card. A new row will start after five cards have been drawn.

On your turn players can (1) place a parasite on a host card, (2) move a parasite to an adjacent host or action card, (3) draw a card to place in play or (4) pass.

Drawing a card will activate a scoring phase. All previous cards are then evaluated for scoring condition. Cards of your color without any parasite tokens score the full value for the player. Cards with parasites where the value of the parasites are of less than value that the host card it is on will score points for the owner of the parasite and card owner. EXAMPLE: A three green parasite on a five blue host card will score three points for green and two points for blue.

Cards where the total of the parasites is equal to or more than the host card total, will NOT score for either player. Action cards allow players to perform a special action like move other players tokens or look through the deck.

The game is over when all the cards have been drawn and placed into the play area. The player with the highest point after all the cards have been drawn is the winner.

name: The Sherlock Holmes Puzzle Case
description:
Step into the shoes of Doctor Watson

A quiz game where players take turns attempting to answer puzzling questions in order to earn points.

On their turn, a player chooses a card from one of four piles each representing a different difficulty level. The player then turns a sand timer and if they can correctly answer the question in time they score points. Either way, play then passes to the next player.

More difficult questions are worth more points and each player has a single Moriarty card and a Sherlock card which can each be used once per game to score in additional ways. A Moriarty card is used at the start of another players turn as a bet that they will not answer the question correctly (or in time). If the bet is correct, the Moriarty player earns the points for the question. A Sherlock card can be used on your own turn to make the question worth double the points. However, it must be played before reading the question!

name: Wipeout
description:
From the back of the box:
"Surf's Up!  It's a fast-paced, wave-riding race!  You'll ride the waves, race against other awesome surfer dudes, and avoid wiping out in a fast-action, excellent surfin' experience!  But beware!  If you don't boogie fast enough you'll be swallowed up by the wildest wave you've ever seen!  You gotta' be quick...or wipe out!"

Wipeout is played on a vertical plastic tower with rows and columns of slots into which plastic surfers can be inserted.  Each player starts with one surfer at the top edge of the tower.  A "wave" made of green goo is loaded into a "regulator" at the top of the tower, which dispenses the goo to pour down the tower at a preselected speed.  Players then race their surfers down the tower by rolling a die which controls movement.  They try to reach the bottom of the tower first while avoiding being engulfed by the goo and "wiping out."

name: 1, 2, 3 bunter Papagei
description:
Craok! Croak!
Colorful parrots are waiting to fill their plumage with chips of the correct color which can be found in the eggs. 
The player who completes his parrot with all the color chips first, has won the game. 
Have fun with this thrilling seeking/searching game!

How to play:
At your turn you take an egg and open it. 
Hopefully you will find a chip that isn't already on your board. 
If this is the case, you can add it to the board. 
If not, you put the chip back into the egg and withdraw it with the other eggs. Then it's the next players turn. 
The first player who has filled his board with all colored chips has won the game.

name: Trzęsienie Danych
description:
Game is about learning how to safety use computer and handle your digital data and personal information. 
Players spent "time" to buy available cards that can be used to handle specific bad events.
Example of cards that can be bought:
"Secure Connection"
"Encrypted Emails"
"Privacy settings"
Example of bad events: 
"Data leak"
"Stalker"

Good cards help prepare for bad events that will damage players. Player who received the least damage wins the game.

name: Beginning Sounds 3-in-a-Row Game
description: Beginning Sounds 3-in-a-Row Game is a bingo-type game designed to teach the recognition of beginning letter sounds. Players have 3-by-3 cards marked with pictures. Like Bingo, in order to win, a player must complete a row of three across, down or diagonally.  Unlike Bingo, each player takes turns spinning a spinner marked with five letters. They must then find a picture that starts with the letter spun. Only the player spinning may mark his or her card.  The game comes with four separate sets of cards to cover the entire alphabet.

name: Innløsning: A Rune Casting Game of Redemption
description:
Rise again, noble Völva! You are being given a second chance for Glory!

As you walk the grey and barren lands of Helheim, songs of Valhalla fill your heart and empower your very soul.  However, you are Völva, a seer or ‘wand carrier’.  Unlike warriors that got to fight and die in battle to be carried off to Valhalla, you were only an adviser and tactician who assisted by drawing upon the power of the Runes to help your fellow warriors in their battles.

However, Freya smiles upon you and offers redemption to the Völva who can prove their abilities.  By using the runes to create gateways, you must work your way up from Helheim to Asgard.  By being victorious in challenges and tests of strength, you gain valour and come one step closing to being accepted in Valhalla!

OVERVIEW
Innløsning is an abstract 2 player rune casting game where players are fallen Völva souls in Helheim looking for redemption so that they may enter Valhalla, the hall of the Chosen.  Players must create gateways, starting in Helheim, and sequentially working their way up to Asgard.  By casting the runes, they will generate power to create those gateways and activate them.  However, this is not enough to gain entrance to Valhalla.  You must also gain enough valour by using the runes to overcome challenges, or to defeat your rival, by drawing upon the strength provided by the gateways.  When you have earned enough valour and opened all the gateways, only then will you be allowed entrance to Valhalla!

GOAL
The first player to have gateways in each of the 9 realms, open all their gateways and have 11 valour wins.

name: Box O'Cats
description:
Box O'Cats challenges 3 to 5 players to fire up their imaginations solving bizarre dilemmas. Each round, players creatively convince the others that their unusual items best solve the presently perplexing predicament.

Giant robots are attacking. Do you whip out the dynamite or the magic spells?

Or maybe you're pulling the ultimate prank. Will you choose the rubber chicken or the warped time machine? Or maybe... the Box O'Cats?

name: Huzzah! 2: Dark Woods, Dreadful Fields – the Wilderness Campaign
description:
The second volume in the Huzzah series concentrates entirely upon the Wilderness Campaign. It will consist of 8 scenarios.

May 5th Scenarios
1 Opening Guns North. Warren's Fifth Corps temporarily punctures Ewell's center, only to be hurled back by a vicious Confederate counter-attack led by the inestimable John Gordon.
2 Sixth Corps Joins the Fray. An extension of scenario 1, as reinforcements from Sedgewick's Corps descends upon Ewell's left flank. Hay's Louisiana Tigers help stem the blue flood.
3 Hill to the Attack! Two divisions of A.P. Hill's 3rd Corps rattles up the Orange Plank Road and attempts to cut Grant in half by capturing the Brock Road intersection. A single division, commanded by VIth Corps George Getty, stands in his way. Hancock's II corps arrives just in time to save the day. Or will he?

May 6th Scenarios
1 Lee to the Rear! Early in the morning of may 6th Hancock strikes Heth's and Wilcox's divisions of Hill's 3rd Corps. Both divisions have been strung out and exhausted from the previous days fighting. They expected Longstreet's early arrival, and so neglect to fortify their line. Hancock initially drives them almost handsomely, and nearly captures Lee's HQ at the Widow Tapp farm. The engagement witnesses one of the most dramatic moments of the war, when the Marble Man himself proposes to lead the Texas Brigade of Longstreet corps in a counter-charge.
2 Like a Wet Blanket. Now fully arrived, Longstreet strikes the over-extended flank of Hancock's corps. In a swift and dramatic reversal it's now the Yankee's turn to run. Will Longstreet capture the ever important Brock Road intersection?
3 Gordon's Assault. John B. Gordon, ever the thorn in Grant's side, jumps the VI corps and nearly shatters the Yankee's right. Only the coming of darkness brings his assault to an end.

The Campaign Games
These games implement Custom command rules simulating the problems of controlling armies over vast broken terrain. Lee struggles to coordinate his widely separated wings, while Grant whittles away the days, goading reluctant subordinates to action.
1 The May 5th Mini-Campaign game. Combines scenarios 1, 2, and 3, and provides additional units and player options.
2 The full Campaign Game. Play the entire 2 day battle. The ever-frustrating Burnside provisions both the Yankee crux and the Rebel hope. Will you dare achieve better than the historical stalemate?

Projected Contents:

    8 11"x17" maps that mate together to form various portions of the battlefield, or all together for the entire campaign.
    560 half inch die-cut full-color counters
    1 Rules booklet
    1 Scenarios booklet
    2 Sheets of charts and tables
    2 Ten-sided dice
    1 Game box


(source: One Small Step website))

name: Holy Roman Empire: The Thirty-Years War
description:
Holy Roman Empire is a political and military game of the 17th Century struggle for empire that plunged Europe into one of its longest and most destructive wars. Up to six players control the major dynasties of the era, fielding armies, navies, and engaging in diplomatic intrigue, bribery decide who will wear the crown of the Holy Roman Empire.

The year is 1619. Matthias, emperor of Germany, has gone to his grave. A year-old rebellion in the imperial province of Bohemia had divided the empire along religious and political lines. Bohemian rebels have elected a minor German prince, Frederick, elector Palatine, as their king. Protestant princelings rally to Frederick, elevating his status to that of a rival to Em­peror Ferdinand II, Archduke of Austria, for the imperial throne. As mercenary armies are raised against Ferdinand, the Catholic King of Spain and Duke of Bavaria rally to his side. France and Sweden turn their attention to Germany in eager anticipation of the dismemberment of their great rival, the Holy Roman Empire.
